Description: Wall sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; below, black-figure decoration consisting of three male figures marching or walking to right; from left, only head with added red beard and hair of first figure and tip of spear remaining; head with red hair, part of tunic and left hand holding spear of second figure; possibly part of red tunic of third figure; possible inscription on lip.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.47)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 269, no. 51)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 391-2, no. B565)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0452) (Phase 1)
